attributes.action: Change Stamp Duty to a banded system like Income Tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Following the decision just recently by the government to increase the 0% threshold to which you don’t have to pay stamp duty from £125,000 to £175,000, this is only helping those who can actually buy a property below £175,000 – how does this help the majority of us where house prices are much higher?

Q: How can this be made fair to everyone?

A: Change the Stamp Duty to a banded system, in the same way as Income Tax.

Fact - if you bought a property today for £300,000 it would cost you £9,000 in SD. If it were banded like income tax it would cost £2,250 (£0 on the first £175k, 1% on the next £75,000, then 3% on the next £50,000).

OK, the government is not going to like losing so much money, but even if the bands were adjusted it would still be a fairer system.

If a house is bought for £255,000 the SD bill would be a staggering £7,650 instead of £2,500 just because you’d been unable to buy it for £5,000 less at £250,000! That extra £5,000 on the purchase price has increased the SD bill by £5,150! Ouch! It’s just not fair!
